wikipedia_page.main: Wing Commander Hubert Dinwoodie,  (24 March 1896 – 28 August 1968) was an officer in the Royal Air Force and a recipient of the George Cross shortly after the end of the Second World War for defusing bombs in Germany in 1946.

response: * Acting Squadron Leader Hubert Dinwoodie, , (72819), Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve.
* Hubert Dinwoodie (1896–1968), Royal Air Force officer
* Wing Commander Hubert Dinwoodie GC, OBE, MC (1896–1968) RAF officer and recipient of the George Cross
